column4: anyone know how to access another partition, i just started with fedora and i cant figure out how to get to the other partition
- u have to mount the partition to be able to access it
- try this.. dc to you /mnt folder, sudo mkdir otherdrive
- then sudo mount -t ext3 /dev/hd? (other drive letter there/part there)  /mnt/otherdrive
- search for mount drives or something similar in the ubuntu forums
- basically what u have to do is create a mount pt for the other drive/partition u want to access
- then mount the drive, then its accessible
- i was just giving u the commands for it, to try it out...
how do i make myself the root in the terminal
- use sudo before the command
- or use what Chap just said..lol
- when u try to sudo?
- what did u type? --curious
- space between hda1 and /mnt i think would help ur saying mount type this here...
- any luck?
- whut happened?
- how do u know its destroyed?
- sry did u fdisk -l and make sure u have right part?
- and the error can come up for a few reasons, that dont mean part is dead
- not necessarily
- you still might wanna check make sure ur mount is good and everythings set right b4 giving up on the partition
- if you have or can d/l a copy of Knoppix, itll auto mount anything it can from live cd
- and let you see whats good w/no console or terminal commands
